Tools class¶

class core.Tools(data_prefix='temp_data', no_log=False, tuning_parameters={}, logfile_name=None, config_file_name='config.orb', silent=False)¶

Bases: object

Parent class of all classes of orb.

Implement basic methods to read and write FITS data, display messages, feed a logfile and manage the server for parallel processing.

__init__(data_prefix='temp_data', no_log=False, tuning_parameters={}, logfile_name=None, config_file_name='config.orb', silent=False)¶

Initialize Tools class.

Parameters:
  • data_prefix¶ – (Optional) Prefix used to determine the header of the name of each created file (default ‘temp_data’)
  • no_log¶ – (Optional) If True no log file is created (default False).
  • tuning_parameters¶ – (Optional) Some parameters of the methods can be tuned externally using this dictionary. The dictionary must contains the full parameter name (class.method.parameter_name) and its value. For example : {‘InterferogramMerger.find_alignment.BOX_SIZE’: 7}. Note that only some parameters can be tuned. This possibility is implemented into the method itself with the method core.Tools._get_tuning_parameter().
  • config_file_name¶ – (Optional) name of the config file to use. Must be located in orb/data/.
  • silent¶ – If True only error messages will be diplayed on screen (default False).
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_close_pp_server(js)¶

Destroy the parallel python job server to avoid too much opened files.

Note

Please refer to http://www.parallelpython.com/ for sources and information on Parallel Python software.

_create_list_from_dir(dir_path, list_file_path, image_mode=None, chip_index=None, prebinning=None)¶

Create a file containing the list of all FITS files at a specified directory and returns the path to the list file.

Parameters:
  • dir_path¶ – Directory containing the FITS files
  • list_file_path¶ – Path to the list file to be created
  • image_mode¶ – (Optional) Image mode. If not None the given string will be written at the first line of the file along with the chip index.
  • chip_index¶ – (Optional) Index of the chip, must be an integer. Used in conjonction with image mode to write the first directive line of the file which indicates the image mode.
  • prebinning¶ – (Optional) If not None, must be an integer. Add another directive line for data prebinning (default None).
Returns:

Path to the created list file
_get_basic_frame_header(dimx, dimy, config_file_name='config.orb')¶

Return a specific part of a header that can be used for image files or frames. It creates a false WCS useful to get a rough idea of the angular separation between two objects in the image.

The header is returned as a list of tuples (key, value, comment) that can be added to any FITS file created by core.Tools.write_fits(). You can add this part to the basic header returned by core.Tools._get_basic_header()

Parameters:
  • dimx¶ – dimension of the first axis of the frame
  • dimy¶ – dimension of the second axis of the frame
  • config_file_name¶ – (Optional) Name of the configuration file (config.orb by default).
_get_basic_header(file_type, config_file_name='config.orb')¶

Return a basic header as a list of tuples (key, value, comment) that can be added to any FITS file created by core.Tools.write_fits().

Parameters:
  • file_type¶ – Description of the type of file created.
  • config_file_name¶ – (Optional) Name of the configuration file (config.orb by default).
_get_basic_spectrum_cube_header(axis, wavenumber=False)¶

Return a specific part of a header that can be used for a spectral cube. It creates the wavelength axis of the cube.

The header is returned as a list of tuples (key, value, comment) that can be added to any FITS file created by core.Tools.write_fits(). You can add this part to the basic header returned by core.Tools._get_basic_header() and core.Tools._get_frame_header()

Parameters:
  • axis¶ – Spectrum axis. The axis must have the same length as the number of frames in the cube. Must be an axis in wavenumber (cm1) or in wavelength (nm)
  • wavenumber¶ – (Optional) If True the axis is considered to be in wavenumber (cm1). If False it is considered to be in wavelength (nm) (default False).
_get_basic_spectrum_frame_header(frame_index, axis, wavenumber=False)¶

Return a specific part of a header that can be used for independant frames of a spectral cube. It gives the wavelength position of the frame.

The header is returned as a list of tuples (key, value, comment) that can be added to any FITS file created by core.Tools.write_fits(). You can add this part to the basic header returned by core.Tools._get_basic_header() and core.Tools._get_frame_header()

Parameters:
  • frame_index¶ – Index of the frame.
  • axis¶ – Spectrum axis. The axis must have the same length as the number of frames in the cube. Must be an axis in wavenumber (cm1) or in wavelength (nm).
  • wavenumber¶ – (Optional) If True the axis is considered to be in wavenumber (cm1). If False it is considered to be in wavelength (nm) (default False).
_get_basic_spectrum_header(axis, wavenumber=False)¶

Return a specific part of a header that can be used for a 1D spectrum. It creates the wavelength axis.

The header is returned as a list of tuples (key, value, comment) that can be added to any FITS file created by core.Tools.write_fits(). You can add this part to the basic header returned by core.Tools._get_basic_header() and core.Tools._get_frame_header()

Parameters:
  • axis¶ – Spectrum axis. The axis must have the same length as the spectrum length. Must be an axis in wavenumber (cm1) or in wavelength (nm)
  • wavenumber¶ – (Optional) If True the axis is considered to be in wavenumber (cm1). If False it is considered to be in wavelength (nm) (default False).
_get_config_file_path()¶

Return the full path to the configuration file given its name.

The configuration file must exist and it must be located in orb/data/.

Parameters:config_file_name¶ – Name of the configuration file.
_get_config_parameter(param_key, optional=False)¶
Return a parameter written in a config file located in
orb/data/
Parameters:
  • param_key¶ – Key of the parameter to be read
  • optional¶ – (Optional) If True, a parameter key which is not found only raise a warning and the method returns None. Else, an error is raised (Default False).

Note

A parameter key is a string in upper case (e.g. PIX_SIZE_CAM1) which starts a line and which must be followed in the configuration file by an empty space and the parameter (in one word - no empty space). The following words on the same line are not read. A line not starting by a parameter key is considered as a comment. Please refer to the configuration file in orb/data/ folder:

## ORB configuration file 
# Author: Thomas Martin <thomas.martin.1@ulaval.ca>

## Instrumental parameters
PIX_SIZE_CAM1 20 # Size of one pixel of the camera 1 in um
PIX_SIZE_CAM2 15 # Size of one pixel of the camera 2 in um

  • standard_table_name¶ – (Optional) Name of the standard table file (default std_table.orb).
Returns:

A tuple [standard file path, standard type]. Standard type can be ‘MASSEY’ of ‘CALSPEC’.

Parameters:standard_table_name¶ – Name of the standard table file
_get_tuning_parameter(parameter_name, default_value)¶

Return the value of the tuning parameter if it exists. In the other case return the default value.

This method is used to help in setting some tuning parameters of some method externally.

Warning

The value returned if not the default value will be a string.

Parameters:
  • parameter_name¶ – Name of the parameter
  • default_value¶ – Default value.
_image_binning(a, binning)¶

Return mean binned image.

Parameters:
  • image¶ – 2d array to bin.
  • binning¶ – binning (must be an integer >= 1).
..note:: Only the complete sets of rows or columns are binned
so that depending on the bin size and the image size the last columns or rows can be ignored. This ensures that the binning surface is the same for every pixel in the binned array.

Print the traceback of the calling function and log it into the log file.

_print_error(message)¶

Print an error message and raise an exception which will stop the execution of the program.

Error messages are written in the log file.

Parameters:message¶ – The message to be displayed.
_print_msg(message, color=False, no_hdr=False)¶

Print a simple message.

Simple messages are written in the log file.

Parameters:
  • message¶ – The message to be displayed.
  • color¶ – (Optional) If True, the message is diplayed in color. If ‘alt’, an alternative color is displayed.
  • no_hdr¶ – (Optional) If True, The message is displayed as it is, without any header.
_print_traceback(no_hdr=False)¶

Print a traceback and log it into the logfile.

Parameters:no_hdr¶ – (Optional) If True, The message is displayed as it is, without any header.

Note

This method returns a traceback only if an error has been raised.

_print_warning(message, traceback=False)¶

Print a warning message. No exception is raised.

Warning messages are written in the log file.

Parameters:
  • message¶ – The message to be displayed.
  • traceback¶ – (Optional) If True, print traceback (default False)
_read_sitelle_chip(hdu, chip_index, substract_bias=True)¶

Return chip data of a SITELLE FITS image.

Parameters:
  • hdu¶ – pyfits.HDU Instance of the SITELLE image
  • chip_index¶ – Index of the chip to read. Must be 1 or 2.
  • substract_bias¶ – If True bias is automatically substracted by using the overscan area (default True).
_update_fits_key(fits_name, key, value, comment)¶

Update one key of a FITS file. If the key doesn’t exist create one.

Parameters:
  • fits_name¶ – Path to the file, can be either relative or absolut.
  • key¶ – Exact name of the key to be updated.
  • value¶ – New value of the key
  • comment¶ – Comment on this key

Note

Please refer to http://www.stsci.edu/institute/software_hardware/pyfits/ for more information on PyFITS module. And http://fits.gsfc.nasa.gov/ for more information on FITS files.

open_file(file_name, mode='w')¶

Open a file in write mode (by default) and return a file object.

Create the file if it doesn’t exist (only in write mode).

Parameters:
  • fits_name¶ – Path to the file, can be either relative or absolute.
  • mode¶ – (Optional) Can be ‘w’ for write mode, ‘r’ for read mode and ‘a’ for append mode.
read_fits(fits_name, no_error=False, nan_filter=False, return_header=False, return_hdu_only=False, return_mask=False, silent=False, delete_after=False, data_index=0, image_mode='classic', chip_index=None, binning=None)¶

Read a FITS data file and returns its data.

Parameters:
  • fits_name¶ – Path to the file, can be either relative or absolut.
  • no_error¶ – (Optional) If True this function will only display a warning message if the file does not exist (so it does not raise an exception) (default False)
  • nan_filter¶ – (Optional) If True replace NaN by zeros (default False)
  • return_header¶ – (Optional) If True return a tuple (data, header) (default False).
  • return_hdu_only¶ – (Optional) If True return FITS header data unit only. No data will be returned (default False).
  • return_mask¶ – (Optional) If True return only the mask corresponding to the data file (default False).
  • silent¶ – (Optional) If True no message is displayed except if an error is raised (default False).
  • delete_after¶ – (Optional) If True delete file after reading (default False).
  • data_index¶ – (Optional) Index of data in the header data unit (Default 0).
  • image_mode¶ – (Optional) Can be ‘sitelle’ or ‘classic’. If in ‘sitelle’ mode, the parameter chip_index must also be set to 0 or 1. In this mode only one of both SITELLE quadrants is returned. In ‘classic’ mode the whole frame is returned (default ‘classic’).
  • chip_index¶ – (Optional) Index of the chip of the SITELLE image. Used only if image_mode is set to ‘sitelle’ In this case, must be 1 or 2. Else must be None (default None).
  • binning¶ – (Optional) If not None, returned data is binned by this amount (must be an integer >= 1)

Note

Please refer to http://www.stsci.edu/institute/software_hardware/pyfits/ for more information on PyFITS module. And http://fits.gsfc.nasa.gov/ for more information on FITS files.

write_fits(fits_name, fits_data, fits_header=None, silent=False, overwrite=False, mask=None, replace=False, record_stats=False)¶

Write data in FITS format. If the file doesn’t exist create it with its directories.

If the file already exists add a number to its name before the extension (unless ‘overwrite’ option is set to True).

Parameters:
  • fits_name¶ – Path to the file, can be either relative or absolut.
  • fits_data¶ – Data to be written in the file.
  • fits_header¶ – (Optional) Optional keywords to update or create. It can be a pyfits.Header() instance or a list of tuples [(KEYWORD_1, VALUE_1, COMMENT_1), (KEYWORD_2, VALUE_2, COMMENT_2), ...]. Standard keywords like SIMPLE, BITPIX, NAXIS, EXTEND does not have to be passed.
  • silent¶ – (Optional) If True turn this function won’t display any message (default False)
  • overwrite¶ – (Optional) If True overwrite the output file if it exists (default False).
  • mask¶ – (Optional) It not None must be an array with the same size as the given data but filled with ones and zeros. Bad values (NaN or Inf) are converted to 1 and the array is converted to 8 bit unsigned integers (uint8). This array will be written to the disk with the same path terminated by ‘_mask’. The header of the mask FITS file will be the same as the original data (default None).
  • replace¶ – (Optional) If True and if the file already exist, new data replace old data in the existing file. NaN values do not replace old values. Other values replace old values. New array MUST have the same size as the existing array. Note that if replace is True, overwrite is automatically set to True.
  • record_stats¶ – (Optional) If True, record mean and median of data. Useful if they often have to be computed (default False).

Note

float64 data is converted to float32 data to avoid too big files with unnecessary precision

Note

Please refer to http://www.stsci.edu/institute/software_hardware/pyfits/ for more information on PyFITS module and http://fits.gsfc.nasa.gov/ for more information on FITS files.

Cube class¶

class core.Cube(image_list_path, data_prefix='temp_data_', config_file_name='config.orb', project_header=[], wcs_header=[], calibration_laser_header=[], overwrite=False, silent_init=False, no_log=False, tuning_parameters={}, indexer=None, logfile_name=None)¶

Bases: core.Tools

Generate and manage a virtual frame-divided cube.

Parameters:
  • image_list_path¶ – Path to the list of images which form the virtual cube. If image_list_path is set to ‘’ then this class will not try to load any data. Can be useful when the user don’t want to use or process any data.
  • config_file_name¶ – (Optional) name of the config file to use. Must be located in orb/data/
  • data_prefix¶ – (Optional) Prefix used to determine the header of the name of each created file (default ‘temp_data’)

Note

A frame-divided cube is a set of frames grouped together by a list. It avoids storing a data cube in one large data file and loading an entire cube to process it.

__getitem__(key)¶

Implement the evaluation of self[key].

Note

There is no interpretation of the negative indexes.

Note

To make this function silent just set Cube()._silent_load to True.

__init__(image_list_path, data_prefix='temp_data_', config_file_name='config.orb', project_header=[], wcs_header=[], calibration_laser_header=[], overwrite=False, silent_init=False, no_log=False, tuning_parameters={}, indexer=None, logfile_name=None)¶

Initialize Cube class.

Parameters:
  • image_list_path¶ – Path to the list of images which form the virtual cube. If image_list_path is set to ‘’ then this class will not try to load any data. Can be useful when the user don’t want to use or process any data.
  • config_file_name¶ – (Optional) name of the config file to use. Must be located in orb/data/ (default ‘config.orb’).
  • data_prefix¶ – (Optional) Prefix used to determine the header of the name of each created file (default ‘temp_data’).
  • project_header¶ – (Optional) header section describing the observation parameters that can be added to each output files (an empty list() by default).
  • wcs_header¶ – (Optional) header section describing WCS that can be added to each created image files (an empty list() by default).
  • calibration_laser_header¶ – (Optional) header section describing the calibration laser parameters that can be added to the concerned output files e.g. calibration laser map, spectral cube (an empty list() by default).
  • overwrite¶ – (Optional) If True existing FITS files will be overwritten (default False).
  • silent_init¶ – (Optional) If True no message is displayed at initialization.
  • no_log¶ – (Optional) If True no log file is created (default False).
  • tuning_parameters¶ – (Optional) Some parameters of the methods can be tuned externally using this dictionary. The dictionary must contains the full parameter name (class.method.parameter_name) and its value. For example : {‘InterferogramMerger.find_alignment.BOX_SIZE’: 7}. Note that only some parameters can be tuned. This possibility is implemented into the method itself with the method core.Tools._get_tuning_parameter().
  • indexer¶ – (Optional) Must be a core.Indexer instance. If not None created files can be indexed by this instance.
  • logfile_name¶ – (Optional) Give a specific name to the logfile (default None).
export(export_path, x_range=None, y_range=None, z_range=None, fits_header=None, overwrite=False)¶

Export cube as one FITS file.

Parameters:
  • export_path¶ – Path of the exported FITS file
  • x_range¶ – Tuple (x_min, x_max)
  • y_range¶ – Tuple (y_min, y_max)
  • z_range¶ – Tuple (z_min, z_max)

Please refer to http://www.stsci.edu/institute/software_hardware/pyfits/ for more information on PyFITS module and http://fits.gsfc.nasa.gov/ for more information on FITS files.

get_interf_energy_map()¶

Return the energy map of an interferogram cube

get_mean_image()¶

Return the mean image of a cube (corresponding to a deep frame for an interferogram cube or a specral cube).

Note

In this process NaNs are considered as zeros.

get_quadrant_dims(quad_number, div_nb=None, dimx=None, dimy=None)¶

Return the indices of a quadrant along x and y axes.

Parameters:
  • quad_number¶ – Quadrant number
  • div_nb¶ – (Optional) Use another number of divisions along x and y axes. (e.g. if div_nb = 3, the number of quadrant is 9 ; if div_nb = 4, the number of quadrant is 16)
  • dimx¶ – (Optional) Use another x axis dimension. Other than the axis dimension of the managed data cube
  • dimy¶ – (Optional) Use another y axis dimension. Other than the axis dimension of the managed data cube
get_resized_data(size_x, size_y)¶
Resize the data cube and return it using spline
interpolation.

This function is used only to resize a cube of flat or dark frames. Note that resizing dark or flat frames must be avoided.

Parameters:
  • size_x¶ – New size of the cube along x axis
  • size_y¶ – New size of the cube along y axis

Warning

This function must not be used to resize images containing star-like objects (a linear interpopolation must be done in this case).

get_resized_frame(index, size_x, size_y, degree=3)¶

Return a resized frame using spline interpolation.

Parameters:
  • index¶ – Index of the frame to resize
  • size_x¶ – New size of the cube along x axis
  • size_y¶ – New size of the cube along y axis
  • degree¶ – (Optional) Interpolation degree (Default 3)

Warning

To use this function on images containing star-like objects a linear interpolation must be done (set degree to 1).

get_spectrum_energy_map()¶

Return the energy map of a spectrum cube.

Note

In this process NaNs are considered as zeros.

get_zmean(nozero=False, center=False)¶

Return a vector containing frames median.

Parameters:
  • nozero¶ – If True zeros are removed from the median computation. If there’s only zeros, median frame value will be a NaN (default False).
  • center¶ – If True only the center of the frame is used to compute median.
get_zmedian(nozero=False, center=False)¶

Return a vector containing frames mean.

Parameters:
  • nozero¶ – If True zeros are removed from the mean computation. If there’s only zeros, mean frame value will be a NaN (default False).
  • center¶ – If True only the center of the frame is used to compute mean.
get_zstat(nozero=False, stat='mean', center=False)¶

Return a vector containing frames stat (mean, median or std).

Parameters:
  • nozero¶ – If True zeros are removed from the stat computation. If there’s only zeros, stat frame value will be a NaN (default False).
  • stat¶ – Type of stat to return. Can be ‘mean’, ‘median’ or ‘std’
  • center¶ – If True only the center of the frame is used to compute stat.
get_zstd(nozero=False, center=False)¶

Return a vector containing frames std.

Parameters:
  • nozero¶ – If True zeros are removed from the std computation. If there’s only zeros, std frame value will be a NaN (default False).
  • center¶ – If True only the center of the frame is used to compute std.
is_same_2D_size(cube_test)¶

Check if another cube has the same dimensions along x and y axes.

Parameters:cube_test¶ – Cube to check
is_same_3D_size(cube_test)¶

Check if another cube has the same dimensions.

Parameters:cube_test¶ – Cube to check

TextColor class¶

class core.TextColor¶

Define ANSI Escape sequences to display text with colors.

Warning

Note that colored text doesn’t work on Windows, use disable() function to disable coloured text.

disable()¶

Disable ANSI Escape sequences for windows portability

End the progress bar and display the total time needed to complete the process.

Parameters:silent¶ – If True remove the progress bar from the screen. Further diplayed text will be displayed above the progress bar.

Update the progress bar.

Parameters:
  • index¶ – Index representing the progress of the process. Must be less than index_max.
  • info¶ – (Optional) Information to be displayed as comments

MemFile class¶

class core.MemFile(memfile_path)¶

Manage memory file.

A memory file is a file containing options that must be shared by multiple classes. Options in this file are temporary.

This class behaves as a dictionary reflecting the content of the memory file on the disk.

__getitem__(key)¶

Implement the evaluation of self[key]

__init__(memfile_path)¶

Init Memfile Class

Parameters:memfile_path¶ – Path to the memory file.
__iter__()¶

Return an iterator object

__setitem__(key, value)¶

Implement the evaluation of self[key] = value

update()¶

Update memory file with the data contained in self.mem

Indexer class¶

class core.Indexer(data_prefix='temp_data', no_log=False, tuning_parameters={}, logfile_name=None, config_file_name='config.orb', silent=False)¶

Bases: core.Tools

Manage locations of created files.

All files locations are stored in a text-like file: the index file. This file is the ‘real’ counterpart of the index (which is ‘virtual’ until core.Indexer.update_index() is called). This method is called each time core.Indexer.__setitem__() is called.

This class can be accessed like a dictionary.

__getitem__(file_key)¶

Implement the evaluation of self[file_key]

  • file_key¶ – Key name of the file
  • file_path¶ – Path to the file

_get_index_path()¶

Return path of the index

_index2group(index)¶

Convert an integer (0, 1 or 2) to a group of files (‘merged’, ‘cam1’ or ‘cam2’).

get_path(file_key, file_group=None, err=False)¶

Return the path of a file recorded in the index.

Equivalent to self[file_key] if the option file_group is not used.

Parameters:
  • file_key¶ – Key name of the file to be located
  • file_group¶ – (Optional) Add group prefix to the key name. File group must be ‘cam1’, ‘cam2’, ‘merged’ or their integer equivalent 1, 2, 0. File group can also be set to None (default None).
  • err¶ – (Optional) Print an error instead of a warning if the file is not indexed.
load_index()¶

Load index file and rebuild index of already located files

set_file_group(file_group)¶

Set the group of the next files to be recorded. All given file keys will be prefixed by the file group.

Parameters:file_group¶ – File group must be ‘cam1’, ‘cam2’, ‘merged’ or their integer equivalent 1, 2, 0. File group can also be set to None.
update_index()¶

Update index files with data in the virtual index

Lines class¶

class core.Lines¶

Bases: core.Tools

This class manages emission lines names and wavelengths.

Spectral lines rest wavelength:

============ ======== =======
  Em. Line    Vaccum    Air
============ ======== =======
[OII]3726    372.709  372.603
[OII]3729    372.988  372.882
Hepsilon     397.119  397.007
Hdelta       410.292  410.176
Hgamma       434.169  434.047
[OIII]4363   436.444  436.321
Hbeta        486.269  486.133
[OIII]4959   496.030  495.892
[OIII]5007   500.824  500.684
[NII]6548    654.984  654.803
Halpha       656.461  656.280
[NII]6583    658.523  658.341
[SII]6716    671.832  671.647
[SII]6731    673.271  673.085

air_lines_nm = {'[OII]3726': 372.603, '[OII]3729': 372.882, '[OIII]5007': 500.684, '[SII]6716': 671.647, 'Hbeta': 486.133, 'Hdelta': 410.176, '[OIII]4959': 495.892, '[NII]6548': 654.803, 'Hepsilon': 397.007, 'Halpha': 656.28, 'Hgamma': 434.047, '[OIII]4363': 436.321, '[SII]6731': 673.085, '[NII]6583': 658.341}¶

Air emission lines wavelength

air_sky_lines_nm = None¶

Air sky lines wavelength

get_line_name(lines, air=True)¶

Return the name of a line or a list of lines given their wavelength.

Parameters:
  • lines¶ – List of lines wavelength
  • air¶ – (Optional) If True, rest wavelength is considered to be in air. If False it is considered to be in vacuum (default True).
get_line_nm(lines_name, air=True, round_ang=False)¶

Return the wavelength of a line or a list of lines

Parameters:
  • lines_name¶ – List of line names
  • air¶ – (Optional) If True, air rest wavelength are returned. If False, vacuum rest wavelength are returned (default True).
  • round_ang¶ – (Optional) If True return the rounded wavelength of the line in angstrom (default False)
get_sky_lines(nm_min, nm_max, delta_nm, line_nb=0)¶

Return sky lines in a range of optical wavelength.

Parameters:
  • nm_min¶ – min wavelength of the lines in nm
  • nm_max¶ – max wavelength of the lines in nm
  • delta_nm¶ – wavelength resolution in nm as the minimum wavelength interval of the spectrum. Lines comprises in half of this interval are merged.
  • line_nb¶ – (Optional) number of the most intense lines to retrive. If 0 all lines are given (default 0).
round_nm2ang(nm)¶

Convert a wavelength in nm into a rounded value in angstrom

Parameters:nm¶ – Line wavelength in nm
sky_lines_file_name = 'sky_lines.orb'¶

Name of the sky lines data file.

vac_lines_nm = {'[OII]3726': 372.709, '[OII]3729': 372.988, '[OIII]5007': 500.824, '[SII]6716': 671.832, 'Hbeta': 486.269, 'Hdelta': 410.292, '[OIII]4959': 496.03, '[NII]6548': 654.984, 'Hepsilon': 397.119, 'Halpha': 656.461, 'Hgamma': 434.169, '[OIII]4363': 436.444, '[SII]6731': 673.271, '[NII]6583': 658.523}¶

Vacuum emission lines wavelength

OptionFile class¶

class core.OptionFile(option_file_path)¶

Bases: core.Tools

Manage an option file.

An option file is a file containing keywords and values and optionally some comments indicated by ‘#’, e.g.:

## ORBS configuration file 
# Author: Thomas Martin <thomas.martin.1@ulaval.ca>
# File : config.orb
## Observatory
OBSERVATORY_NAME OMM # Observatory name
TELESCOPE_NAME OMM # Telescope name
INSTRUMENT_NAME SpIOMM # Instrument name
OBS_LAT 45.455000 # Observatory latitude
OBS_LON -71.153000 # Observatory longitude

Note

The special keyword INCLUDE can be used to give the path to another option file that must be included. Note that existing keywords will be overriden so the INCLUDE keyword is best placed at the very beginning of the option file.

Note

Repeated keywords override themselves. Only the protected keywords (‘REG’, ‘TUNE’) are all kept.

__getitem__(key)¶

Implement the evaluation of self[key].

__init__(option_file_path)¶

Initialize class

Parameters:option_file_path¶ – Path to the option file
get(key, cast=<type 'str'>)¶

Return the value associated to a keyword.

Parameters:
  • key¶ – keyword
  • cast¶ – (Optional) Cast function for the returned value (default str).

Defined for the special keyword ‘BAD_FRAMES’.

Defined for the special keyword ‘FILTER_EDGES’.

Get fringes

Defined for the special keyword ‘FRINGES’.

get_lines(nm_min=None, nm_max=None, delta_nm=None)¶

Get lines parameters.

Defined for the special keyword ‘LINES’.

All optional keywords are only used if the keyword SKY is used.

Parameters:
  • nm_min¶ – (Optional) min wavelength of the lines in nm (default None).
  • nm_max¶ – (Optional) max wavelength of the lines in nm (default None).
  • delta_nm¶ – (Optional) wavelength resolution in nm as the minimum wavelength interval of the spectrum. Lines comprises in half of this interval are merged (default None).
get_regions_parameters()¶

Get regions parameters.

Defined for the special keyword ‘REG’.

get_tuning_parameters()¶

Return the list of tuning parameters.

Defined for the special keyword ‘TUNE’.

ParamsFile class¶

class core.ParamsFile(file_path, reset=True)¶

Bases: core.Tools

Manage the correspondance between multiple dict containing the same parameters and a file on the disk.

__del__()¶

ParamsFile destructor

__getitem__(key)¶

implement Instance[key]

__init__(file_path, reset=True)¶

Init ParamsFile class.

Parameters:
  • file_path¶ – Path of the output file where all parameters are stored (Note that this file will automatically be overwritten if reset is set to True).
  • reset¶ – (Optional) If True the output file is overwritten. If False and if the output file already exists data in the file are read and new data is appended (default True).
append(params)¶

Append a dict to the file.

Parameters:params¶ – A dict of parameters
